data.title: Ernest Benjamin Chapman (1878-1951)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 11 Feb 2018 | Created 30 Jul 2013

This page has been accessed 579 times.

Biography

Ernest Benjamin Chapman was born on 29 Dec 1878 in Wollombi, New South Wales, Australia as the first child of Benjamin Samuel Chapman and Matilda Jane Jurd. He had two siblings, namely: May Linda, and Daphne Elma. He died on 11 May 1951 in St Albans, New South Wales, Australia. When he was 24, he married Elizabeth Selina Bailey,daughter of Francis Bailey and Ann Thompson, on 08 Apr 1903 in St Albans, New South Wales, Australia.

Ernest Benjamin Chapman and Elizabeth Selina Bailey had the following children:

Varney Eric Chapman was born on 07 Feb 1904 in St Albans, New South Wales, Australia. He died on 27 Feb 1927 in St Albans, New South Wales, Australia.

Russell Verne Chapman was born on 01 Feb 1906 in Wisemans Ferry, New South Wales, Australia. He died on 03 Jan 1961 in Wyong, New South Wales, Australia. He married Elsie Belinda Arnold on 04 Sep 1936 in St Albans, New South Wales, Australia.

Hilda Joyce Chapman was born in 1911 in St Albans, New South Wales, Australia. She died in 1989 in Wyong, New South Wales, Australia. She married Claude Diplock in 1927 in Cessnock, New South Wales, Australia.

Reginald Ernest Chapman was born on 29 Dec 1911 in St Albans, New South Wales, Australia. He died in 1959 in Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia. He married Doris Amy Rowbottom in 1933 in Wollombi, New South Wales, Australia.

Benjamin Stanton Chapman was born on 12 Mar 1913 in St Albans, New South Wales, Australia. He died in 1973 in Cessnock, New South Wales, Australia. He married Lorna Brenda Jurd in 1935 in Windsor, New South Wales, Australia.

Enid Beryl Chapman was born on 09 Sep 1920 in St Albans, New South Wales, Australia. She died on 21 Apr 2011 in Gosford, New South Wales, Australia. She married *Alfred Noel Bernsdorff in 1938 in Cessnock, New South Wales, Australia.

Notes for ERNEST BENJAMIN CHAPMAN:

Residents heard with regret of the sudden passing of a native and former resident of the Valley in Mr. Ernest Benjamin Chapman on May 11, whilst visiting his son Ben, at Wattagan, at the age of 72 years.

The late Mr. Chapman was the elder son of the late Mr. and Mrs. B. S. Chapman, of St. Albans. In 1903 he married Miss Selina Bailey who predeceased him 10 and 1/2 years ago. They resided in St. Albans until about 1923, when they moved to Cessnock. In his younger days Mr. Chapman was a noted horseman, and for some years in St. Albans conducted a general store and then a butchery business which was carried on by his sons, and finally a grandchild, until about 1945. He was buried in St. Albans general cemetery on May 12, the service being conducted by the Rev. G. Simmons.
